moves.1. g3 Nf6 2. Bg2 g6 3. b3 Bg7 4. Bb2 O-O: With this formation, I was going  for the King's Indian
moves.7. Ne2 Nc6 8. d5 Ne7 9. f4 Nd7 10. g4 f5: Following the pawn exchanges, i am working on taking control of the f file
moves.13. Ng3 Nxg3 14. hxg3 Nc5 15. Nd2 Bf5 16:
Each of the moves is very dangerous. White wants to mate me thanks to its control of the h file. 
My response to that was to attract the Queen and basically win the Queen on my back rank
moves.20. O-O-O Ke8 21. Qxh7 Kd7 22. Qxg6 Rxg4: We are equal as far as material,however white has a positional advantage
moves.23. Qf5+ Ke8: I didn't see the check fork
moves.24. Qxg4 e4 25. Bxg7 Qxg7 26. Nxe4 Qa1+: I resigned. In retrospect, I maybe had a small chance to draw,but with minus a Rook, I didn't think I would succeed
